intro: Sphaeralcea grossulariifolia, commonly known as the desert four o'clock, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Sphaeralcea grossulariifolia is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
